body:
This is basically a rant page where I state ^^^.

When A Person Calls Someone They Don't Know A "Kid."
Honestly, every time I see this happen, I always think of the person calling the other person a kid the real kid. Ok...that sounded weird. 

Example:
Bob: dum kid
Me: ^ The real kid....

People Think Saying No Offense Won't Hurt People's Feelings.
This bothers me A LOT. Most of the time its just some jerk who is always angry. 

Thats it for today.

People Who Think Swearing Makes Them "Cool."
I dont even need to explain this....I mean, so many people think if they say the f word & the n word in every sentence, theyre "cool."

title: Things People Say That Bother me.

replies.body: Omg, yes! I hate it when people say things like "Who is this kid?" I find it ridiculous because they have no idea how old they are. I don't normally say anything though, to stay calm.
replies.body_tagged: Omg, yes! I hate it when people say things like "Who is this kid?" I find it ridiculous because they have no idea how old they are. I don't normally say anything though, to stay calm.

replies.body: I hate it when people tell me "you only won because you have -100 ping" when i am lagging...
replies.body_tagged: I hate it when people tell me "you only won because you have -100 ping" when i am lagging...

replies.body: When someone is being immature, I sometimes call them "son" or "child" just due to me viewing them like that. I have no idea how old they are but they seem to be in the age group that classifies as a child. If they get humiliated by that, which they seem to do, they deserve it. I'd never call someone "child" or something if they own me in a fight or something of the nature, only when someone is breaking the rules.
replies.body_tagged: When someone is being immature, I sometimes call them "son" or "child" just due to me viewing them like that. I have no idea how old they are but they seem to be in the age group that classifies as a child. If they get humiliated by that, which they seem to do, they deserve it. I'd never call someone "child" or something if they own me in a fight or something of the nature, only when someone is breaking the rules.

replies.body: Say for instance you tell a joke, a swear word will instantly make it more funny due to the psychological fact that you're not meant to say it; and that's what people like :) (not a good thing, just human nature)
